question: Which scientist is credited with coining the term 'cell'?
short_explanation: Robert Hooke coined the term 'cell' after observing cork under a microscope.
long_explanation: In 1665, Hooke described small box-like structures in cork as 'cells' because they reminded him of monastery cells.
clinical_application: Understanding cell discovery helps massage therapists appreciate how microscopic anatomy relates to hands-on practice.
text: Which scientist is credited with coining the term 'cell'?

question: Which of the following is NOT part of the classical Cell Theory?
answers: All living things are made of cells
The cell is the basic unit of life
short_explanation: Not all cells contain a nucleus, such as prokaryotes.
long_explanation: The classical cell theory includes: all living things are made of cells, cells are the basic unit of life, and all cells come from other cells. Nuclei are only present in eukaryotic cells.
clinical_application: Differentiating cell types helps massage professionals understand tissue repair and immune response.
text: Which of the following is NOT part of the classical Cell Theory?
options: All living things are made of cells
The cell is the basic unit of life
abcd: A. All living things are made of cells
B. Cells arise from pre-existing cells
C. All cells contain a nucleus
D. The cell is the basic unit of life

question: Which scientist stated that all animals are made of cells?
short_explanation: Theodor Schwann concluded that all animals are made of cells.
long_explanation: In 1839, Schwann extended cell theory to animals, uniting plants and animals under one biological principle.
clinical_application: Understanding tissue origins is essential for applying massage techniques that affect animal (human) cells.
text: Which scientist stated that all animals are made of cells?

question: Which scientist concluded that all plants are composed of cells?
short_explanation: Matthias Schleiden stated that plants are made of cells.
long_explanation: Schleiden observed plant tissues under microscopes and proposed that cells are the basic units of plant life.
clinical_application: Relating to cellular makeup helps massage therapists understand the plant-based therapies used in complementary modalities.
text: Which scientist concluded that all plants are composed of cells?

question: Rudolf Virchow contributed to Cell Theory by stating:
answers: Cells are produced only from other cells
short_explanation: Virchow said cells come only from pre-existing cells.
long_explanation: Virchow expanded on cell theory by rejecting spontaneous generation and emphasizing biogenesis: 'Omnis cellula e cellula.'
clinical_application: Massage aids healing by supporting cellular processes rooted in this principle of cellular reproduction.
text: Rudolf Virchow contributed to Cell Theory by stating:
options: Cells are produced only from other cells
correctAnswer: Cells are produced only from other cells
abcd: B. Cells are produced only from other cells
D. Cells develop from DNA only

question: What does Cell Theory suggest about the function of cells?
answers: Cells are only used for reproduction
Cells carry out all vital life processes
Cells only exist in animals and plants
short_explanation: Cells carry out all life functions.
long_explanation: Cell theory emphasizes that each cell performs basic life processes like energy use, waste removal, and repair.
clinical_application: Massage therapy supports these life functions through improved circulation and nutrient delivery.
text: What does Cell Theory suggest about the function of cells?
options: Cells are only used for reproduction
Cells carry out all vital life processes
Cells only exist in animals and plants
correctAnswer: Cells carry out all vital life processes
abcd: A. Cells do not function independently
B. Cells are only used for reproduction
C. Cells carry out all vital life processes
D. Cells only exist in animals and plants

question: Which technology greatly contributed to the development of Cell Theory?
long_explanation: Advances in microscope design allowed scientists like Hooke and Leeuwenhoek to see and describe cells for the first time.
clinical_application: Microscopic insights enhance understanding of the tissues massage therapists work with.
text: Which technology greatly contributed to the development of Cell Theory?

question: Which of the following is consistent with Cell Theory?
answers: All organisms begin as a single cell
short_explanation: All organisms begin as a single cell.
long_explanation: From fertilization to growth, all organisms start as one cell that divides and differentiates into many specialized cells.
clinical_application: This principle supports how massage may influence early cellular regeneration and healing in therapy.
text: Which of the following is consistent with Cell Theory?
options: All organisms begin as a single cell
correctAnswer: All organisms begin as a single cell
abcd: B. All organisms begin as a single cell
D. Cells can survive without energy

question: Cell Theory applies to which of the following organisms?
short_explanation: Cell theory applies to all life forms, including fungi.
long_explanation: Every living organism—animal, plant, or fungus—is made up of cells, making the theory universal.
clinical_application: Knowledge of cellular structure across organisms supports a holistic view of health and massage’s role.
text: Cell Theory applies to which of the following organisms?

question: How did Anton van Leeuwenhoek contribute to cell studies?
answers: He first observed live cells under a microscope
short_explanation: He was the first to observe live cells.
long_explanation: Using handcrafted microscopes, Leeuwenhoek saw living microorganisms, paving the way for microbiology and cell biology.
clinical_application: This work underlies infection control, relevant for maintaining hygiene in massage practice.
text: How did Anton van Leeuwenhoek contribute to cell studies?
options: He first observed live cells under a microscope
correctAnswer: He first observed live cells under a microscope
abcd: A. He developed the Cell Theory
B. He first observed live cells under a microscope
